author: trent_vanepps
content:
üïØÔ∏è **Announcement** üïØÔ∏è  the initial open contribution period for the KZG Ceremony has run for 2 months (jan 13-March 13) and is **now closed**.

at this point, there are over **75k contributions**: the largest setup of this kind by an order of magnitude! üìà 

From here, the lobby will be allowed to run down for existing entrants, but not add additional ones. 

Next, we will move into the Special Contribution Period (April 1-16): more complex contributions have been allocated slots. Some have large groups collectively generating entropy or particular setup restrictions which may need more time for computation. These contributions are were proposed by the community and funded through the KZG Grants Round.

Following this period, we are considering reopening for one short additional open period, with additional sybil checks. Thanks everyone for being part of this project! üôè

author: bridge-bot
content:
<CarlBeek> Because G2 ops are much slower than G1 ops. So if we did the same number of G1 and G2 points, the ceremony would take much longer.

But more because we did an optimisation:

If you do a KZG commitment for a polynomial of degree n less than the m powers of tau you have, then you need to do a low degree proof to prove that the commitment is of degree n. We avoid the need for this by doing multiple setups of different sizes and we choose our polynomials to have n=m and if we need a larger m, we just choose the next largest m. To make this all doable, we only do the number of G1 points that we need for each m

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> > <dankrad>  65 allows to create KZG multiproofs up to size 64 elements. (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <dnunez> @dankrad why 65 in G2?)
